tit.e: Kisha (to shoot an arrow with riding a horse)
Kisha (shooting an arrow while riding a horse)
tit.cmt: タイトルなので説明括弧削除しました。

sen.j: 騎射（きしゃ）は、騎上（ウマの上）から弓 (武器)で矢を射ること。
sen.e: Kisya means to shoot an arrow (weapon) with riding a horse.
Kisha means to shoot an arrow or other weapon while riding a horse.
Kisha means to shoot an arrow or other weapon while riding a horse.

sen.j: 大陸では狩りには欠かせない技術であるため、騎馬民族にこれを得意とするものが多い。
sen.e: The equestrian people are good at doing Kisha since this technique is necessary to live in the continent.
As this technique was necessary to hunt and live, many horse-based societies were good at doing kisha on the continent.
As this technique was necessary to hunt and live, many horse-based societies were good at doing kisha on the continent.

sen.j: 紀元前8世紀頃にスキタイ人により始められる。
sen.e: Kisha was started by Scythian around 8 B.C.
Kisha was started by the Scythians in around 8 B.C.
Kisha was started by the Scythians in around 8 B.C.

sen.j: 遊牧民族の彼らは牧草を求め常に移動しならが生活、また屢々馬に跨がり他民族と闘っていたが、彼らのこういった生活文化の中で自然的必要性から騎射は開発・発展して来たものと考えられる。
sen.e: Since they are nomadic tribes, they moved around to live to look for grasses and also fought against other tribes with riding horses, it is presumed that Kisha was developed and improved through the culture of their life style, as it was naturally necessary for them.

Since they were nomadic tribes, they moved around to live to look for good vegetation and also fought against other tribes on horseback, and it is presumed that Kisha was developed and improved through the manner of their lifestyle, as it was naturally necessary for them.

Since they were nomadic tribes, they moved around to live to look for good vegetation and also fought against other tribes on horseback, and it is presumed that Kisha was developed and improved through the manner of their lifestyle, as it was naturally necessary for them.

sen.j: 騎射はすぐに中央アジアの遊牧民の間に波及し、フン族、アヴァール人、マジャル人など同様の遊牧民族に次々と取り入れられ、後にモンゴル族にも及び、古代世界に普及して行った。
sen.e: Kisha was soon spread through nomadic tribes of Central Asia, and it was spread into other nomadic tribes such as Hun, アヴァール人,マジャル人 one after another, later on it reached Mongolian and spread into society of ancient times.
sen.cmt: アヴァール人, マジャル人→定訳不明
sen.e: Kisha skills soon spread through the nomadic tribes of Central Asia, and spread into other nomadic tribes such as the Hun, アヴァール人,マジャル人 one after another, later on reaching Mongolia and spreading into society in ancient times.
sen.cmt: Grammar. I am not sure who アヴァール人 andマジャル人 refer to.
sen.e: Kisha skills soon spread through the nomadic tribes of Central Asia, and spread into other nomadic tribes such as the Hun, the Avar, the Magyar, one after another, later on reaching Mongolia and spreading into society in ancient times.
sen.cmt: アヴァール人(アバール人)→the Avarマジャル人(マジヤール人)→the Magyar[英辞郎]

sen.j: 古代において彼ら遊牧民族の騎射術が定住民族に及ぼした影響は大きいが、しかし常に移動を繰り返すために当時の彼らの実体は詳しく解っていない。
sen.e: In ancient times, equestrian people gave big influence of their technique of Kisha to settled people, however there is no detailed record of those equestrian people since they kept on moving places to live and was hard to keep record of them.

In ancient times, equestrian peoples heavily influenced the techniques of settled people regarding kisha, however there is no detailed record of those equestrian peoples since they kept on moving from place to place to live and it was hard to keep a record of them.

In ancient times, equestrian peoples heavily influenced the techniques of settled people regarding kisha, however there is no detailed record of those equestrian peoples since they kept on moving from place to place to live and it was hard to keep a record of them.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: The history
History
History

sen.j: 騎射は世界史的にはスキタイ文化（紀元前8世紀～紀元前3世紀）の初期から存在し、この疾走する馬上から矢を射るという特異性から古代ギリシア人はケンタウロスを想像したと考えられている。
sen.e: Kisha existed since early stage when Scythian culture started (8 B. C. to 3 B. C.) and it is presumed ancient Greek people presumed to imagine Centaur when they had original look of someone shooting an arrow while riding horse.

Kisha has existed since the beginning of Scythian culture (8 B. C. to 3 B. C.) and it is presumed that ancient Greek people imagined the Centaur when they first saw someone shooting an arrow while riding a horse.

Kisha has existed since the beginning of Scythian culture (8 B.C. to 3 B.C.) and it is presumed that ancient Greek people imagined the Centaur when they first saw someone shooting an arrow while riding a horse.
sen.cmt: スペース削除しました。

sen.j: スキタイ人は上下がやや非対称の短弓の両端に硬い『弭』を取り付け、また鏃を大きな鉄製から小さなブロンズ製にする事で、フン族の弓に勝った。
sen.e: The Scythian were able to win the battle against Hun by putting solid "耳" on the two ends of short bow which top and bottom was dissymmetric, and they changed arrowhead from iron to small blonds arrowheads.

The Scythians were able to win a battle against the Huns by putting a solid "耳" on the two ends of the short bow of which the top and bottom were asymmetric, and they changed arrowhead from iron to small bronze arrowheads.

The Scythians were able to win a battle against the Huns by putting a solid "nock" on the two ends of the short bow of which the top and bottom were asymmetric, and they changed arrowhead from iron to small bronze arrowheads.
sen.cmt: 調査したところ、『耳』は『弭』（はず）の事だと思われますので、原文訂正し、"nock"としました。[参考：http://www.northallegheny.org/schools/mms/tsa%202006/tsa2007/bow%20and%20arrow.html]

sen.j: またさらに完成度を高めた弓として、トルコ民族はさらに軽量・コンパクトな弓を用い、矢は両端が細く中央部に膨らみを持たせた造りにして飛翔力を高めた。
sen.e: The Turk used lighter and smaller bow, which was completed with the better quality, the bow has thin top and bottom ends with fat body in the centre so that the bow would fly better.
The Turks used lighter and smaller bows completed to a higher quality, and the bow has thin top and bottom ends with a fat body in the centre so that the bow would fly better.
The Turks used lighter and smaller bows completed to a higher quality, and the bow has thin top and bottom ends with a fat body in the centre so that the bow would fly better.

sen.j: モンゴル族はさらに『ストリングブリッジ』を設けるなど、より速く、貫通力を上げることで、重装騎兵団に対しより有効な戦力となって行った。
sen.e: The Mongolian even put "string bridge" to make faster and stronger bow, to have stronger weapon to fight against heavily armed troops.
The Mongolians even added a "string bridge" to make a faster and stronger bow, in order to have a stronger weapon to fight heavily armed troops.
The Mongolians even added a "string bridge" to make a faster and stronger bow, in order to have a stronger weapon to fight heavily armed troops.

sen.j: 戦場において弓騎兵の主な役割は軽騎兵と同じく、前哨・斥候兵として敵を攪乱することにある。
sen.e: In the battle field, the main role of the archery cavalry soldier is to disturb enemies as outpost or as scouting party, same role as light cavalry.
On the battlefield, the main role of the archery cavalry soldier is to disturb enemies at an outpost or as a scouting party, basically the same role as light cavalry.
On the battlefield, the main role of the archery cavalry soldier is to disturb enemies at an outpost or as a scouting party, basically the same role as light cavalry.

sen.j: 弓騎兵は接近戦を避けながら、敵の脇、及び後方から敵を素早く急襲する。
sen.e: The archery cavalry soldier quickly give sudden attack from side and back of the enemy while they try to escape to go too close to the enemy.
Archery cavalry soldiers quickly give sudden attack from the side and back of the enemy while they try to avoid being too close to the enemy.
Archery cavalry soldiers quickly give sudden attack from the side and back of the enemy while they try to avoid being too close to the enemy.

sen.j: その為軽装備であり、その機動力を活かして馬を止めること無く前進、後退、右、左へと絶え間なく俊敏に動き回りながら弓矢で敵を攻撃する戦術をとる。
sen.e: Therefore, the soldiers were lightly outfitted and it make them easy to move, they were able to constantly move forward, backward, to the right and left without stopping the horse to attack the enemy with the bows.

Therefore, the soldiers were lightly outfitted and it make it easy for them to move, and they were able to constantly move forward, backward, to the right and left without stopping the horse to attack the enemy with the bows.

Therefore, the soldiers were lightly outfitted and it make it easy for them to move, and they were able to constantly move forward, backward, to the right and left without stopping the horse to attack the enemy with the bows.

sen.j: 敵の武器が届かない距離を保ちながら攻撃をし、着実に敵を後退、飛び道具を持たない敵兵は弓騎兵の攻撃下では手も足も出ずに士気を奪われ隊列を乱した。
sen.e: They kept on keeping distance with the enemy and attack them where enemy could not fight back against them, they made sure to let the enemy go backwards, while it made the morale of the enemies to fight back lower since they had no shooting weapon and could not do anything to fight against archery cavalry soldiers.

They remained at a distance from the enemy and attacked them where the enemy could not fight back, they made sure to let the enemy go backwards, while it reduced the morale of the enemies to fight back since they had no shooting weapon and could not do anything to fight against the archery cavalry soldiers.

They remained at a distance from the enemy and attacked them where the enemy could not fight back, they made sure to let the enemy go backwards, while it reduced the morale of the enemies to fight back since they had no shooting weapon and could not do anything to fight against the archery cavalry soldiers.

sen.j: 弓騎兵は概ね重装歩兵に対して脅威となり、特に気温が高く木の無い平坦な地域においては敏捷性に優れる弓騎兵は鈍重な重装歩兵団に対して極めて有利である。
sen.e: The archery cavalry usually became threat to heavily armed soldiers, especially in the flat area without no trees around with high temperature, archery cavalry soldiers were much more sufficient in terms of agility rather than heavily armed soldiers who moved heavily and slowly.

The archery cavalry usually became a threat to heavily armed soldiers, especially in flat areas without trees with high temperatures, where archery cavalry soldiers were much more sufficient in terms of agility than heavily armed soldiers who moved heavily and slowly.

The archery cavalry usually became a threat to heavily armed soldiers, especially in flat areas without trees with high temperatures, where archery cavalry soldiers were much more sufficient in terms of agility than heavily armed soldiers who moved heavily and slowly.

sen.j: 事実、弓騎兵に対抗し得るのは弓矢や弓騎兵のみであった。
sen.e: In fact, it was only bows and arrows or archery cavalry soldiers who could fight against archery cavalry soldiers.
In fact, it was only bows and arrows or archery cavalry soldiers who could possibly resist archery cavalry soldiers.
In fact, it was only bows and arrows or archery cavalry soldiers who could possibly resist archery cavalry soldiers.

sen.j: 特にパルティアンショットは敵と相対せず退却しながら矢を射続けるため、敵を苦しめヨーロッパ人の間では知られた騎射戦術であった。
sen.e: Especially Parthian shot was well known technique of shooting bows in Europe, which keep on shooting bows to enemies when leaving, without facing them to give them hard time.
Especially, the Parthian shot was a well known technique of shooting bows in Europe, and was where bows continued to be shot at enemies when leaving, without facing them to give them hard time.
Especially, the Parthian shot was a well known technique of shooting bows in Europe, and was where bows continued to be shot at enemies when leaving, without facing them to give them hard time.

sen.j: 弓騎兵は『カルラエの戦い（紀元前53年）』、『ワールシュタットの戦い（13世紀）』で中心的役割を果たし、両戦とも敵兵が弓騎兵に対して直接戦闘に固執した為に勝利を収めた。
sen.e: The archery cavalry played an important role in "the Battle of Karurae (B. C. 53)" and "The battle of Warushutatto (13th century)", since the enemies in both battles tried to fight directly to the archery cavalry, they were able to win.

The archery cavalry played an important role in the Battle of Karurae of 53BC and the Battle of Warushutatto (13th century), since as the enemies in both battles tried to fight directly with the archery cavalry, they were able to win.

The archery cavalry played an important role in the Battle of Karurae of 53 B.C. and the Battle of Warushutatto (the 13th century), since as the enemies in both battles tried to fight directly with the archery cavalry, they were able to win.
sen.cmt: B.C.に訂正しました。スペース補足しました。the 補足しました。

sen.j: 西欧の重装歩兵は機敏な弓騎兵に苦戦し、東方諸国の弓騎兵は十字軍に対し多くの実績を残した。
sen.e: The heavily armed foot soldiers in Western Europe had hard time fighting against archery cavalry soldiers, the archery cavalry soldiers in the Eastern countries made big achievement against the Crusades.
The heavily armed foot soldiers in Western Europe had a hard time fighting against archery cavalry soldiers, and archery cavalry soldiers in Eastern countries made big achievements in the Crusades.
The heavily armed foot soldiers in Western Europe had a hard time fighting against archery cavalry soldiers, and archery cavalry soldiers in Eastern countries made big achievements in the Crusades.

sen.j: 『ローマの信徒への手紙』にはサルマタイの弓騎兵やオスマントルコのイェニチェリ騎兵が画かれている。
sen.e: In "the Epistle to the Romans (book of the Bible)" there are paintings of archery cavalry soldiers of Sarmatae or cavalry soldiers of イェニチェ.
sen.cmt: イェニチェリ騎兵→定訳不明
sen.e: In the book of the Bible "The Epistle to the Romans" there are paintings of the archery cavalry soldiers of Sarmatae or cavalry soldiers of イェニチェ.
In the book of the Bible "The Epistle to the Romans," there are paintings of the archery cavalry soldiers of Sarmatae or cavalry soldiers of janissary.
sen.cmt: イェニチェリ→janissary[英辞郎]コンマ補足しました。

sen.j: 遊牧民族の弓騎兵に対し勝利した欧州国家は数少なく、『ヤクサルティス川の戦い（紀元前329年）』では名将アレキサンダー大王が弓騎兵と戦い打ち負かす事に成功した数少ない歴史的勝利の１つである。
sen.e: There are not many European countries who won against archery cavalry soldiers of nomadic tribes, there was one of rare examples in the history of the famous Alexander the Great beat and won the battle against archery cavalry soldiers in "the battle of the Yaxartes river" (B. C. 329).

Few European countries won against the archery cavalry soldiers of the nomadic tribes, and there is one rare example in history where the famous Alexander the Great beat and won a battle against archery cavalry soldiers in the Battle of the Yaxartes River in 329BC.

Few European countries won against the archery cavalry soldiers of the nomadic tribes, and there is one rare example in history where the famous Alexander the Great beat and won a battle against archery cavalry soldiers in "the Battle of the Yaxartes River" in 329 B.C.
sen.cmt: 原文の『』に合せて" "を補足しました。B.C.に訂正しました。スペース補足しました。

sen.j: アレキサンダーはこの戦いでマケドニア王国領土をアジアの一部にまで伸ばすが、それでも遊牧国家の中心部を攻略する事は叶わなかった。
sen.e: Alexander the Great spread the land of Macedonia to part of Asia, even so he was not able to capture the central part of the nomadic nation.
Alexander the Great expanded the territory of Macedonia into Asia, but even so he was not able to capture the central part of the nomadic nation.
Alexander the Great expanded the territory of Macedonia into Asia, but even so he was not able to capture the central part of the nomadic nation.

sen.j: 中世の『ハッティンの戦い』は重装歩兵に対し弓騎兵が執拗な攻撃をしかけ敵の戦意を喪失させる事で勝った古典的な事例である。
sen.e: "The Battle of Hattin" in the Medieval period was the classic example of archery cavalry soldiers attack heavily armed foot soldier obstinately so that they would not want to fight any more and they won the battle.

The Battle of Hattin in the Medieval period is a classic example of archery cavalry soldiers attacking heavily armed foot soldiers persistently so that they would not want to fight any more and they won the battle.

"The Battle of Hattin" in the Medieval period is a classic example of archery cavalry soldiers attacking heavily armed foot soldiers persistently so that they would not want to fight any more and they won the battle.
sen.cmt: 原文の『』に合せて" "を補足しました。

sen.j: また、チンギス・カンはモンゴル弓を用いた弓騎兵を擁し、他の遊牧国家と同様の戦術で巨大なモンゴル帝国を築きあげ、全盛期には中国大陸からヨーロッパにまで領土を広げた。
sen.e: Genghis Khan commanded archery cavalry using Mongolian bows, he established huge Mongolian Empire by using same tactic as other nomadic nation, they expended the land from the Chinese continent to Europe in the golden age.

Genghis Khan commanded archery cavalry using Mongolian bows, and he established the huge Mongolian Empire by using the same tactics as other nomadic nations, also they extended their land from the Chinese continent to Europe in their golden age.

Genghis Khan commanded archery cavalry using Mongolian bows, and he established the huge Mongolian Empire by using the same tactics as other nomadic nations, also they extended their land from the Chinese continent to Europe in their golden age.

sen.j: 日本での騎射
sen.e: Kisha in Japan
Kisha in Japan
Kisha in Japan

sen.j: 日本では古代から騎射が行われていたと思われるが、詳細は不明である。
sen.e: It is presumed that Kisha was used from the ancient time, however the details are unknown.
It is presumed that kisha was practiced from ancient times, however details are unclear.
It is presumed that kisha was practiced from ancient times, however details are unclear.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』には「馬的射」「騁射」「馳射」との記述があり、『続日本紀』には奈良時代には騎射は盛んに行われていたとの記述がある。
sen.e: "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), there are description of munamato (shooting on horseback), umayumi (shooting on horseback), haseyumi (shooting on horseback), and in "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued), there was a description that Kisha was popular during Nara period.

In the Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan), there are descriptions of munamato, umayumi, and haseyumi (all kinds of shooting on horseback), and in Shoku Nihongi (Chronicle of Japan Continued), there is a reference to kisha being popular during the Nara Period.

In "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), there are descriptions of 'munamato,' 'umayumi,' and 'haseyumi' (all kinds of shooting on horseback), and in "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued), there is a reference to kisha being popular during the Nara period.
sen.cmt: 原文の『』に合せて" "を補足しました。原文の「」に合せて' 'を補足しました。the 削除しました。period 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 当時は「騎射（うまゆみ、馬弓）」と呼ばれていた。
sen.e: Kisya was called Umayumi at that time.
Kisha was called umayumi at that time.
Kisha was called 'umayumi' at that time.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて' 'を補足しました。

sen.j: 平安時代以降は騎射様式が整理され、流鏑馬・犬追物・笠懸などが成立し、神事・祭礼行事として行われ始める。
sen.e: After Heian period, Kisya style was organized and yabusame (the art of shooting arrows on horseback), inuoumono (dog-hunting event, a skill of an archery), kasagake (horseback archery competition) were established, and they were started being used as part of a Shinto ritual and festival events.

After the Heian Period, the form of kisha was settled and yabusame (the art of shooting arrows on horseback), inuoumono (dog-hunting event, needing archery skills), and kasagake (a horseback archery competition) were established, and they started to be used in Shinto rituals and festival events.

After the Heian period, the form of kisha was settled and yabusame (the art of shooting arrows on horseback), inuoumono (dog-hunting event, needing archery skills), and kasagake (a horseback archery competition) were established, and they started to be used in Shinto rituals and festival events.
sen.cmt: period 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 鎌倉時代には流鏑馬・犬追物・笠懸は「騎射三物」と称され各地で盛んに行われた。
sen.e: In Kamakura period, yabusame, inuoumono, kasagake were called 'Kisha-Mitsumono (three archeries with riding a horse, Inuou-mono, Kasagake and Yabusame)' and were very popular in various places.

During the Kamakura Period, yabusame, inuoumono, and kasagake were called 'Kisha-Mitsumono (the three archeries of riding a horse, Inuou-mono, Kasagake and Yabusame)' and were very popular in various places.
During the Kamakura period, yabusame, inuoumono, and kasagake were called 'Kisha-Mitsumono' (the three archeries of riding a horse) and were very popular in various places.
sen.cmt: period 小文字にしました。括弧の位置を訂正、説明の繰り返しを削除しました。

sen.j: 騎射は弓術の中でも最高位のものとされ、弓が戦場での主戦力でなくなって以降、泰平の江戸時代に置いても武士の表芸としてその位置付けは変わらなかった。
sen.e: Kisha was considered as it had the highest rank among the archery, it was still considered as the same as Samurai's profession during 泰平 Edo period even after the archery was not the main weapon in the battle.

Kisha was considered to be of the highest rank among archery, and it was still considered as the same as a Samurai's profession during 泰平 Edo Period even though archery was no longer the main weapon in battle.

Kisha was considered to be of the highest rank among archery, and it was still considered as the same as a Samurai's profession during the time of quiet in Edo period even though archery was no longer the main weapon in battle.
sen.cmt: 泰平→time of quiet[英辞郎]period 小文字にしました。
